enum.name: PLANCK_STATUS_FAILSAFE
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

enum.name: PLANCK_STATUS_CONTROLLER
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

enum.name: PLANCK_TRACKING_TARGET
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

message.name: STATE_INFO
message.field: Timestamp (micros since boot or Unix epoch)

message.name: TARGET_STATE
message.field: Timestamp (micros since boot or Unix epoch)
GPS velocity in m/s in NORTH direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in m/s in EAST direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in m/s in DOWN direction in earth-fixed NED frame

message.name: VERSION_QUERY_RESPONSE
message.description: Used for obtaining software version numbers. Request and response are the same message
message.field: NULL-terminated string response with version or N/A for query (max 40 chars including NULL-term)

message.name: LANDING_PLATFORM_HEARTBEAT
message.field: Wall-clock time in u-seconds of the landing platform

message.name: LANDING_PLATFORM_STATE
message.description: The state of a landing platform, including WGS84 position and pose information (roll/pitch/yaw) in earth frame
message.field: GPS velocity in m/s in NORTH direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in m/s in EAST direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in m/s in DOWN direction in earth-fixed NED frame
Roll in degrees of the platform
Pitch in degrees of the platform
Yaw in degrees of the platform

message.name: ORBIT_COMMAND
message.description: Instruction for vehicle to orbit landing platform at a fixed radius, at a fixed rate
message.field: Altitude in meters at which orbit takes place
Rate in rad/sec at which to orbit (positive=clockwise)
Distance in meters from center of landing platform to orbit
vehicle direction during orbit (away-relative, positive-right, example: 0=outward)
Target to track (LANDING-PLATFORM=0, >0 indicates target ID to track)

message.name: LEAD_FOLLOW_COMMAND
message.description: Instruction for vehicle to maintain a fixed X/Y position, relative to the landing platform in either earth-frame or platform-frame
message.field: Altitude in meters at which lead/follow takes place
Maintain x distance from landing platform (forward-positive for platform-frame, north-positive for earth-frame)
Maintain y distance from landing platform (starboard-positive for platform-frame, east-positive for earth-frame)
Target to track (LANDING-PLATFORM=0, >0 indicates target ID to track)

message.name: PLANCK_STATUS
message.description: The state of the vehicle, for UX usage
message.field: Vehicle state (IDLE=0, TAKEOFF, STAB, RTB, SEARCHING, LAND_READY, LAND, ORBIT, LEAD_FOLLOW)
Failsafe status bitfield (RC_OK=bit0, COMMBOX_OK=bit1, BATTERY_OK=bit2, COMMBOX_GPS_OK)

message.name: PLANCK_RADIO_STATUS
message.description: The state of various radio links, for UX usage
